ace_sentences: The highest pay grades are 7 times the amount of acceptance to elite colleges if an applicant has a legacy at the college.
A legacy at a college means that someone has previously attended the college.
I wonder why the chances increase drastically after an applicant reaches the highest pay grades.
The data show the likelihood of acceptance to an elite college for an applicant with a legacy at the college.
The data also show the likelihood of acceptance to an elite college for an applicant without a legacy at the college.
